com.cloudant.sync.indexing
Class IndexManager

java.lang.Object
  com.cloudant.sync.indexing.IndexManager

public class IndexManager
extends java.lang.Object

Allows indexes for a Datastore to be defined and queried.

IndexManager instances are not thread safe.

Method Detail

ensureIndexed

public void ensureIndexed(java.lang.String indexName,
                          java.lang.String fieldName)
                   throws IndexExistsException

Registers a new index with type IndexType.STRING that indexes a top-level field of documents.

This method is equivalent to:

     IndexFunction f = new FieldIndexFunction(field);
     datastore.ensureIndexed(name, IndexType.STRING, f);

Parameters:
indexName - case-sensitive name of the index. Can only contain letters, digits and underscores. It must not start with a digit.
fieldName - top-level field use for index values
Throws:
IndexExistsException - if an index with the same name has already been registered.
See Also:
QueryBuilder, IndexType, FieldIndexFunction

ensureIndexed

public void ensureIndexed(java.lang.String indexName,
                          java.lang.String fieldName,
                          IndexType type)
                   throws IndexExistsException

Registers a new index with a certain type that indexes a top-level field of documents.

This method is equivalent to:

     IndexFunction f = new FieldIndexFunction(field);
     datastore.ensureIndexed(name, type, f);

Parameters:
indexName - case-sensitive name of the index. Can only contain letters, digits and underscores. It must not start with a digit.
fieldName - top-level field use for index values
type - IndexType of the index.
Throws:
IndexExistsException - if an index with the same name has already been registered.
See Also:
QueryBuilder, IndexType, FieldIndexFunction

ensureIndexed

public void ensureIndexed(java.lang.String indexName,
                          IndexType type,
                          IndexFunction indexFunction)
                   throws IndexExistsException

Registers an index with the datastore and make it available for use within the application.

The name passed to this function is the one specified at query time, via the QueryBuilder.

The call will block until the given index is up to date.

Parameters:
indexName - case-sensitive name of the index. Can only contain letters, digits and underscores. It must not start with a digit.
type - type of the index.
indexFunction - the function to use to map between a document and indexed value(s).
Throws:
IndexExistsException - if an index with the same name has already been registered.
See Also:
QueryBuilder, BasicDocumentRevision, IndexType, IndexFunction

updateAllIndexes

public void updateAllIndexes()

Makes sure all indexes are up to date.

Each index records the last document indexed using the Datastore object's sequence number. This call causes the changes the the Datastore since the last indexed sequence number to be added to all the indexes that this IndexManager knows about.

Only indexes registered using ensureIndexed(String, IndexType, IndexFunction) or an overloaded version on this IndexManager object will be updated (as otherwise the update function isn't defined).

deleteIndex

public void deleteIndex(java.lang.String indexName)

Deletes an index.

Parameters:
indexName - name of the index to delete

query

public QueryResult query(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> queryWithOptions)

Queries for DocumentRevision objects.

Using a QueryBuilder to create the query is recommended.

Otherwise, the query should have fields as keys and the query for that field as a value.

Parameters:
queryWithOptions - map containing the following:
  • "query": a Map expressing the query
  • "options": an optional Map containing query options
Returns:
an arbitrarily ordered list of DocumentRevisions matching the query.
See Also:
QueryResult

uniqueValues

public java.util.List uniqueValues(java.lang.String indexName)
Return a List of unique values for the given index. The unique values will be determined by the database's DISTINCT operator and will depend on the data type.

Parameters:
indexName - the index to fetch the unique values for.
Returns:
a List of unique values. The type of the array members will be determined by the Indexer's implementation.
